job_title: Lab Assistant II in Martinsburg, WV
pros: Personal office space and desk, public employee benefits vision, dental, hearing, and general health insurance, giving back to the community, helping make your community better in education.
cons: lack of compensation, management abuses position for cheap labor, lack of voice, Goals are set incredibly high, performance evaluations are nearly impossible to reach exceeding expectations status without working for free and performing off the company time (this is actually how my supervisor ended up in his position he worked so hard even saw him working for free off the clock just to meet and exceed management and supervisor's expectations.).

pros: The staff of BRCTC are friendly and kind. They are also supportive and often seeking to help new instructors find an easy time transitioning to the environment.
cons: Low chance of being hired full time.

review_title: Practically one the worst company that I have ever worked for.
pros: The only pro that I can think of is the benefit package and vacation package.
cons:
Metaphorically the college is ran by a mafia. Every staff member has relation to another person, who brought them in. The environment is controlled by individuals who are in a relationship, family, or friends, which makes it hard to communicate issues you may have there. 

I vocalized some of my issues but management refused to make any changes. Management is afraid of training employees  and will not provide proper education resources.  

The turnover rate at this institution is indescribable. There are a handful of individuals who actually care.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty Instructor in Shepherdstown, WV
pros: Strong educational ethics.  I was given great autonomy with how to develop, organize, and run my courses.  Facilities and systems are more than adequate and staff and faculty are helpful and friendly.
cons: I cannot think of anything I would consider a Con great enough to list.  It wasn't a perfect fit for me, but I don't believe the institute is to blame.

pros: Some wonderful coworkers and students. Easy commute, nice building to work in.

review_title: Best Place I've Ever Been Employed
